cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This quick reference cheat sheet provides an example introduction to using the [MATLAB](https://mathworks.cn/) scientific computing language to get started quickly

cards.title: Matrix and array operations
cards.body: MATLAB allows you to use a single arithmetic operator or function to manipulate all values in a matrix

cards.title: Matrix and array operations
cards.body: MATLAB will execute the above statement and return the following results:

cards.title: Matrix and array operations
cards.body: MATLAB will execute the above statement and return the following results:

cards.title: Matrix and array operations
cards.body: To transpose a matrix, use single quotes (`'`)

cards.title: Matrix and array operations
cards.body: Perform standard matrix multiplication using the `*` operator, which computes the inner product between rows and columns

cards.title: concatenation
cards.body:
Concatenation is the process of joining arrays to form larger arrays. In fact, the first array is formed by
concatenating its elements. Pairs of square brackets `[]` are concatenation operators.

cards.title: concatenation
cards.body:
Concatenating arrays next to each other using commas is called horizontal concatenation. Each array must have the same
number of rows. Likewise, semicolons can be used for vertical concatenation if the arrays have the same number of
columns.

cards.title: Matrices and arrays
cards.body: To create an array with four elements per row, separate elements with commas (`,`) or spaces

cards.title: Complex number
cards.body: A complex number has a real part and an imaginary part, and the imaginary unit is the square root of -1.

cards.title: Complex number
cards.body: To represent the imaginary part of a complex number, use i or j.

cards.title: Basic Arithmetic
cards.body:
• [+](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/plus.html) Add numbers, append strings
• [sum](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/sum.html) sum of array elements
• [cumsum](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/cumsum.html) cumulative sum
• [movsum](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/movsum.html) moving sum
